issue.title: Offer mathematics constants in sdf syntax

content.raw: There was some discussion about incorporating xacro into sdf in issue #210 (xacro can do macro substitution and basic arithmetic). I definitely agree that model building should have tools like math constants and the ability to evaluate expressions. The issue is that you really want an actual programming language; for instance xacro is nice, but it doesn't have if statements or a complete set of math functions (not even sin, cos). I personally think it would be more profitable to push in the direction of model building tools written in python or some other scripting language, rather than trying to put everything into sdf.
